tweets.text: The 9th Swift Community Set has gone to the @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyAnglia Iceni House in Ipswich. The team there have been encouraging #Swifts there for many years and have created nest sites in their eaves. An excellent opportunity to boost the declining Swift population here.
What on earth is happening to our town? @EnvAgency no idea if this is related but surely this comes under your jurisdiction?! https://t.co/xHK7gDxQgA

Understand the @EnvAgency have received an application from HS2 to approve the environmental permit to allow them to start tunnelling. We are told by the @EnvAgency that this is not be open for consultancy even through there is significant risk to our rivers and water supply.
@EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe @RedIndustries2 Please do all on your power to save us from this.  If you don't have the power please tell @BorisJohnson .

urls.title: Why Earth Hour matters now more than ever
urls.description: Van Griffiths, Deputy Director for Sustainable Business within the Environment Agency, explains how Earth Hour shines a light on the climate and nature crises.

domain.name: Ongoing News Story
domain.description: Ongoing News Stories like 'Brexit'

tweets.text:
Demand transparency from @EnvAgency!
https://t.co/1EETNEQXZM

Over six years ago we predicted HS2 would make their application to @EnvAgency to approve tunnelling at the last moment and sure enough they have. Why did they do this? purely to avoid public scrutiny of this highly dubious activity that puts rivers and drinking water at risk.
